attributes.short_header: Pedestrian access to North Station will be along Legends Way through April 2017, due to the Hub on Causeway Project
attributes.header: Pedestrian access to North Station will be along Legends Way through April 2017, due to the Hub on Causeway Project
attributes.description: The new path of travel will be along a protected path along Legends Way and across Causeway Street to the station entrances along Haverhill Street. The path will include a barrier and kick-plate for blind and low vision passengers.

attributes.short_header: Buses will replace Green Line D branch service between Newton Highlands and Reservoir on Wed, Mar 8, from 9am to 3pm, due to tree removal
attributes.header: Buses will replace Green Line D branch service between Newton Highlands and Reservoir Stations on Wednesday, March 8, from 9:00 am to 3:00 pm, due to tree removal.
attributes.description:
Due to necessary tree removal, shuttle buses will replace trains between Newton Highlands and Reservoir Stations from 9:00 am to 3:00 pm on Wednesday, March 8, 2017

Regular service will resume at 3:00 p.m. All stops are accessible for persons with disabilities. 

Shuttling the following stops: 
Reservoir
Chestnut Hill
Newton Centre
Newton Highlands

attributes.short_header: Due to the Simon Company's Copley Place construction, Back Bay Stations Dartmouth Street underpass will remain closed until April 8, 2017.
attributes.header: Due to the Simon Company's Copley Place construction, Back Bay Stations Dartmouth Street underpass will remain closed until April 8, 2017.
attributes.description:
Due to Copley Place construction being performed by the Simon Company, the Dartmouth Street underpass  leading to and from the west side of Dartmouth Street at Back Bay Station will be temporarily closed until April 8, 2017.

Customers are encouraged to use the stations main entrance on the east side of Dartmouth Street during the underpass closure. 

Affected routes:
Orange Line
Framingham/Worcester Line
Needham Line
Franklin Line
Providence/Stoughton Line

attributes.short_header: Elev. 941 N Station - Lobby to the Commuter Rail & Boston Garden will remain closed until further notice due to construction of the Boston G
attributes.header: Elevator 941 NORTH STATION - Lobby to the Commuter Rail and Boston Garden will remain closed until further notice due to construction of the Boston Garden Development.
attributes.description: If exiting, return to the fare lobby to use North Station Elevator 912 (lobby to Causeway Street) or pass through the fare gates, walk the full length of the Green Line platform to use North Station Elevator 909 (lobby to Valenti Way). If boarding, cross Causeway Street to use North Station Elevator 912 (lobby to street) or travel one-tenth of a mile down Haverhill Street to the entrance located at the intersection of Haverhill Street and Valenti Way.

attributes.short_header: Buses replacing Red Line between Braintree & Quincy Adams Stations and JFK/UMass & Ashmont Stations on Mar 25 & 26 all day
attributes.header: Buses replacing Red Line service between Braintree & Quincy Adams Stations and JFK/UMass & Ashmont Stations on March 25 & 26 from start to end of service.
attributes.description:
Due to the Winter Resiliency Improvement Program, buses will replace Red Line Braintree branch service between Braintree and Quincy Adams and Ashmont branch service between Ashmont and JFK/UMass in both directions from start to end of service on from start to end of service on Saturday, March 25 and Sunday, March 26.

Regular Red Line train service will resume at the start of service on the following Monday. 

All shuttle bus stops are accessible for persons with disabilities. 

Shuttling the following Braintree branch stops:
Quincy Adams (busway)
Braintree (busway)

Shuttling the following Ashmont branch stops:
JFK/Umass (busway) 
Savin Hill (Connect to shuttle bus service at Dorchester Ave @ Savin Hill Ave) 
Fields Corner (busway) 
Shawmut (Connect to shuttle bus service at Dorchester Ave @ Centre St) 
Ashmont (busway)

attributes.short_header: Please board all trains on the inbound platforms at Haverhill & Bradford except Trains 216 & 222
attributes.header: Please board all trains on the inbound platforms at Haverhill and Bradford except Trains 216 (1:35 pm from Haverhill) and 222 (6:09 pm from Haverhill).
attributes.description:
Due to the Merrimack River Bridge project, trains that operate between Bradford and Haverhill will only use the inbound track. Trains that are bused between Haverhill and Bradford will board on the outbound platform at Bradford for service into Boston. Note: Train 216 (1:35 pm from Haverhill) and Train 222 (6:09 pm from Haverhill) are bused from Haverhill Station to Bradford Station. The outbound platform at Bradford may be accessed via the crossing that is south (to the right when facing the tracks from the parking lot) of the mini-high platforms. Alternatively, the outbound platform can also be accessed via the sidewalk from Laurel Avenue.


Affected stops:
Bradford
Haverhill

attributes.short_header: The pedestrian bridge at the Braintree Parking Garage will be closed beginning Tuesday, February 21, through Summer 2020 due to construction
attributes.header: The pedestrian bridge at the Braintree Parking Garage will be closed beginning Tuesday, February 21, through Summer 2020 due to construction.
attributes.description:
For access to Braintree Station during this closure, travel down to the first floor and use the pedestrian crosswalk to enter the station at the street level.
This closure is due to the South Shore Parking Garages Improvements and Renovations Project. The pedestrian bridge will be replaced by a new garage lobby featuring elevators and stairwells.

Affected routes:
Red Line
210
230
236
Middleborough/Lakeville Line
Kingston/Plymouth Line

attributes.short_header: Elevator 804 PARK STREET - Tremont Street to the Lobby will be reconstructed and will be out of service through June 2017.
attributes.header: Elevator 804 PARK STREET - Tremont Street to the Lobby will be reconstructed and will be out of service through June 2017.
attributes.description: If entering the station, cross Tremont Street to the Boston Common and use Park Street Elevator 978 to the Green Line westbound platform. Red Line platform access is available via the elevator beyond the fare gates. If exiting the station, please travel down the Winter Street Concourse toward Downtown Crossing Station, exit through the fare gates, and take Downtown Crossing Elevator 892 to the street level.
